===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|辵|alt1=辵|𩠐|c1=s|c2=p|ls=psc|t1=walking}}. Simplified to {{Han compound|辶|首}}.

===Etymology===
Possibly derived from {{och-l|導|to go along, to bring along, to conduct}}:
* > "to explain" > "to talk about", and
* > "road, way".

Cognate with {{cog|hmx-pro|*kləuX||road, way}} ({{cog|mww|kev||road}}). See also {{och-l|首}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|どう}}
{{IPAchar|/dau/}} → {{IPAchar|/dɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/doː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とう'}} {{m|ltc|道|tr=dhɑ̀u||road; way}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} {{m|zh|道|tr=dào}}, {{etyl|yue|-}} {{m|zh|道|tr=dou<sup>6</sup>}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|どう|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|どう|hhira=だう}}

# The Way: [[tao]], [[Taoism]]
# {{lb|ja|chiefly|_|historical|sort=とう'}} A region of Japan consisting of multiple [[province]]s or [[prefecture]]s. Feudal Japan was divided into several ''dō''; the only remaining ''dō'' is [[w:Hokkaidō|Hokkaidō]].

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|どう|hhira=だう}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=どう}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ち}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ち}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May be cognate with {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-inline|길||road}}.

More often written as {{ja-l|路}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ち}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|路}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|ち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ち|obsolete}} attaches to place names, indicating a road to that place
#: This usage has generally been replaced by ''-ji'' below.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|じ}}
Derived as a sound shift from ''chi'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

More often written as {{ja-l|路}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|じ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|路}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|じ|hhira=ぢ}}

# a [[road]], a [[street]]
#: {{ja-usex|山'''道'''、長'''道'''|やま-'''じ'''、なが-'''じ'''|a mountain '''road''', a long '''road'''}}
# attaches to place names, indicating a road to that place
#: {{ja-usex|奈良'''道'''|^なら-'''じ'''|'''Road''' to Nara}}
# attaches to a time duration, indicating a [[trip]] taking that length of time
#: {{ja-usex|四日'''道'''|よっか-'''じ'''|a '''trip''' of four days, a four-day-long '''trip'''}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|みち}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みち|御|tr1=mi|pos1=honorific prefix|道|tr2=chi|t2=road, street, way}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The prefix ''mi'' was in reference to the {{m|ja|神|tr=kami||god or spirit}} of roads.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|みち|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|路}}, {{ja-l|途}}, {{ja-l|径}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みち}}

# a [[way]], a [[street]], a [[road]], an [[alley]], a [[path]], a pass for local traffic
# a [[way]] of doing something

=====Usage notes=====
This is the most common term for “road”, “street”, or “way” in modern Japanese.
